courses.name: Methods in Communication Research
courses.desc: This course introduces students to the major research paradigms and research methodologies in the field of communication studies. Corequisite: GL/COMS 1000 6.00.

courses.name: Méthodes de recherche en communications
courses.desc: Ce cours introduit les étudiants aux principaux paradigmes de recherches et de méthodologies dans le champ des études en communication. Condition concomitante : GL/COMS 1000 6.00.

courses.name: Introduction to Communication Studies
courses.desc:
This course introduces the main sub-fields in communication studies and the approaches to studying them from the perspective of the individual, organizations, and society. 
Corequisite: GL/COMS 1100 3.00. Course credit exclusion: GL/COMS 1000 6.00.

courses.name: Introduction aux études en communication
courses.desc: Ce cours initie les étudiants aux principaux sous-domaines des études en communications et aux méthodes employées pour l'analyse de phénomènes individuels, organisationnels et sociaux. Condition concomitante : GL/COMS 1100 3.00. Cours incompatible : GL/COMS 1000 6.00.

courses.name: Social Media, Marketing and Advertising
courses.desc: This course introduces students to the study of interactive, mobile and immediate communication forms (Twitter, YouTube, blogs, etc.) in the service of marketing and the production of promotional material.

courses.name: Les médias sociaux, la publicité et le marketing
courses.desc: Ce cours initie les étudiants à l'étude des modes de communication interactifs, mobiles et intermédiaires (Twitter, Youtube, blogs, etc.) au service du marketing et de la production de matériel de promotion.

courses.name: Pixel Power: Digital Games as Communications
courses.desc:
This course introduces students to key theories for and approaches to the study of digital games. We will consider the role and impact of games in communications by exploring their play, communities, production, and growing industries of streaming and eSports.
Prerequisite: GL/COMS 1910 6.00 or GL/EN 1910 6.00.

courses.name: Le pouvoir des pixels : jeux et communications
courses.desc:
Ce cours présente les principales théories et approches pour l'étude des jeux numériques. Nous examinerons le rôle et l'impact des jeux dans les communications en explorant leurs joueurs, leurs communautés, leur production ainsi que les industries de streaming et des eSports.
Condition préalable : GL/COMS 1910 6.00 ou GL/EN 1910 6.00.

courses.name: Au-delà des mots: communications, langages et médias
courses.desc: Ce cours analyse la construction des cultures et discours organisationnels par le biais de la langue et de différents médias. Il se fonde sur plusieurs cadres théoriques.

courses.name: Computer tools and applications for communication
courses.desc: This course teaches computer applications used in communication for an understanding of computer and Internet architecture, use of databases for communication, advanced tools in office and collaborative work, with a critical eye to issues like security, accessibility and multi-platform communication.

courses.name: Creating and Promoting Web Content
courses.desc: This course teaches tools and knowledge necessary to create, host and promote a web site and its content, with the aim to develop skills to better bridge human needs and technological solutions. Prerequisite: GL/COMS 2200 3.00.

courses.name: Idea, Opinion, Argument: Rhetoric for Academic Settings
courses.desc:
This course introduces students to the theory and practice of effective persuasion in academic discourse. Focusing on written forms of persuasion from various fields, students will gain argumentative expertise by understanding the history and written techniques of rhetorical communication.
Course credit exclusion:  AP/PRWR 2007 3.00.

courses.name: Beyond Borders and Bridges: Transnational Communications
courses.desc: This course addresses implications related to communications, media and language in the context of globalization and increased international interactions. Issues of power relationships as well as theoretical perspectives will be the focus of this course.

courses.name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to Technoculture: Digital Discourse and Design
courses.desc: This course looks at the delivery and reception of digital communication, focusing on effective visual and interaction design. A particular interest will be given to the ethical and cultural dimensions of design practices.

courses.name: Enjeux en communication interculturelle
courses.desc: Ce cours étudie l'importance de la culture dans notre vie quotidienne, et examine les rapports entre la culture et les processus de communication. Le cours fournit des aperçus théoriques, méthodologiques et pratiques dans la communication interculturelle.

courses.name: Practices in Intercultural Communications
courses.desc: This course focuses on the importance of culture in our everyday lives, and the ways in which culture interrelates with and affects communication processes. The course provides theoretical, methodological and practical insights into intercultural communication.

courses.name: Can Theory Save The Planet? Emergent Ideas in Communications 1
courses.desc:
This is the first of two courses offering an overview of new ideas in communications and media studies. It examines the
relevance of theories today. It addresses communicative issues in a context of activism and political transformations.
Prerequisite: GL/COMS 1910 6.00 or GL/COMS 1000 6.00.
Course credit exclusion: GL/COMS 3207 6.00.

courses.name: La théorie peut-elle sauver la planète? Idées émergentes en communications 1
courses.desc:
Premier de deux cours offrant un panorama des nouvelles idées en études des communications et des médias. Il examine la pertinence des théories aujourdhui et explore les problèmes de communication dans un contexte de transformations politiques et dactivisme.
Condition préalable : GL/COMS 1910 6.00 ou GL/COMS 1000 6.00. Cours incompatible : GL/COMS 3207 6.00.

courses.name: The Production of the World Is the Message: Emergent Ideas in Communications 2
courses.desc:
This is the second of two courses offering an overview of new ideas in communications and media studies. It examines how communication and media shapes the world we are presently living in from a variety of novel perspectives.
Prerequisite: GL/COMS 3208 3.00. Course credit exclusion: GL/COMS 3207 6.00.

courses.name: Problems in Professional Writing
courses.desc: Students learn to problem-solve through writing, the essence of good professional communication. They learn to select information for a given audience and choose effective language for the needs of government, business, and industry.

courses.name: Apprendre en faisant / Less reading, more doing: Stage en communications Internship I
courses.desc:
This internship gives students the opportunity to gain work or research experience outside the University, in Canada or abroad, during one semester. Students must work a minimum of 80 hours. A faculty member supervises and grades the internship.
Course credit exclusions: GL/COMS/TRAN 3900 3.00.

courses.name: Digital Media and Publishing
courses.desc: This experiential course gives students the opportunity to develop skills in writing, editing and digital production that will allow them to design and produce a digital arts and culture magazine.

courses.name: Études individuelles
courses.desc: Ce cours permet à un.e étudiant.e et un membre du personnel enseignant de travailler ensemble à un projet supervisé en études des communications et des médias. Il consiste en une étude approfondie dun enjeu de communication particulier (théorique, pratique). Il peut inclure une étude de terrain. Réservé aux étudiant.es de 4e année inscrit.es pour une majeure ou une mineure en Communications. Lapprobation du responsable de la coordination du programme est requise.

courses.name: Individual Studies
courses.desc:
This course brings together one student and one instructor for a supervised project in communication and media studies. It consists of a close examination of a particular communication problem (theoretical and practical). It may or may not include field activities.
Restricted to 4th-year Communications majors and minors. Approval from the Program Coordinator is required.

courses.name: Études individuelles
courses.desc: Ce cours permet à un.e étudiant.e et un membre du personnel enseignant de travailler ensemble à un projet supervisé en études des communications et des médias. Il consiste en une étude approfondie dun enjeu de communication particulier (théorique, pratique). Il peut inclure une étude de terrain. Réservé aux étudiant.es de 4e année inscrit.es pour une majeure ou une mineure en Communications. Lapprobation du responsable de la coordination du programme est requise.

courses.name: Individual Studies
courses.desc:
This course brings together one student and one instructor for a supervised project in communication and media studies. It consists of a close examination of a particular communication problem (theoretical and practical). It may or may not include field activities.
Restricted to 4th-year Communications majors and minors. Approval from the Program Coordinator is required.

courses.name: Dissémination des connaissances: talking taboos and breaking news
courses.desc: This course examines information, knowledge and epistemic formation and diffusion through contemporary case-studies. / Ce cours explore la création et la diffusion d'informations, de connaissances et de systèmes de savoir à travers des études de cas contemporains.

courses.name: Fail. Fail again. Fail better. Mediations and Conflicts
courses.desc: This course examines communication dynamics in interindividual and transnational conflicts. It exposes the ambiguity of communication processes that can feed conflicts and resolve them. It introduces students to theories and practices regading mediation tactics and strategies.

courses.name: Boîte à outils pour les communications d'aujourd'hui : Advanced Communications Research Methods
courses.desc:
This bilingual course introduces students to advanced research methodologies and research tools in the field of communication studies.  Students design and conduct their own research projects. Ce cours bilingue initie les étudiants aux méthodologies et aux outils de recherche avancée en communications. Ils conçoivent et réalisent leurs propres projets de recherche. 
Prerequisite/Condition préalable : GL/COMS 1100 3.00.

courses.name: Rêver aux moutons électriques : pratiques émergentes en communications 1
courses.desc:
Premier de deux cours offrant un panorama des nouvelles pratiques en études des communications et des médias. Il examine spécifiquement les tendances liées aux innovations en ligne et les nouvelles formes de communications mobiles et interpersonnelles.
Cours incompatible : GL/COMS 4203 6.00.

courses.name: Dreaming of Electric Sheep: Emergent Practices in Communications 1
courses.desc:
This is the first of two courses offering an overview of emerging practices in communication & media technologies. This course focuses on trends in web-based innovations as well as on new forms of interpersonal and mobile communication.
Course credit exclusion: GL/COMS 4203 6.00.

courses.name: Une autre fin du monde est possible : pratiques émergentes en communications 2
courses.desc:
Ce cours est le second de deux cours offrant un panorama des nouvelles pratiques technologiques en études des communications et des médias. Il examine comment les tendances émergentes dans ces domaines bouleversent nos vies sur les plans individuel, social et politique.
Cours incompatible : GL/COMS 4203 6.00.

courses.name: Techniques in Business and Technical Writing I
courses.desc: Builds on the skills learned in GL/TRAN 3310 3.00. Students learn to direct their writing to a given audience, to begin to work with layout and design of documents, and develop the skills required by team and project writing. Prerequisite: GL/TRAN/COMS 3310 3.00.

courses.name: De la carte au territoire - From map to territory: Stage en communications Internship II
courses.desc: This internship gives students the opportunity to gain work or research experience outside the University, in Canada or abroad, during one semester. Students must work a minimum of 120 hours. A faculty member supervises and grades the internship.
